title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Namaacha Wind Power Plant, through WorleyParsons Limited

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study to assess the technical and financial viability, as well as economic and social impact of a wind power plant of up to 120 megawatts in Namaacha District, Mozambique. The grantee is eleQtra (Mocambique), Limitada and the U.S. firm WorleyParsons Group Inc. will be undertaking the feasibility study. This will be among Mozambique's first utility-scale wind power plants, thus helping to demonstrate the cost and performance of wind energy for the country, as well as improving access to electricity in Mozambique.

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of State, Diplomatic and Consular Programs
Department of State, Diplomatic and Consular Programs

title.narrative: Solar PV Plus Storage Plant at Nacala Airport, through HDR, Inc.

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study to assess the technical, financial, and economic viability of a solar photovoltaic (PV) plant of up to 100 megawatts (MW), to be developed in increments of 20-40 MW, and an associated energy storage facility of up to 50 MW of capacity to be located on the property of the Nacala International Airport in Nampula Province in northeastern Mozambique (Project). The grantee is WHN Solar, S.A. and the U.S. firm HDR International, Inc. will be undertaking the feasibility study. This will be Mozambique's second utility-scale solar power plant and its first at an airport.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

title.narrative: Inhambane Wind Power Plant, through Delphos International, Ltd.

description.narrative: This grant partially funds a feasibility study to assess the technical, financial and economic viability of a wind power plant of 30 to 50 megawatts along with energy storage of 20 MW (40-80 MWh), as well as associated transmission and interconnection infrastructure near Praia da Rocha in Inhambane Province, Mozambique (Project). The grantee is Ventos de Inhambane, S.A. and the U.S. firm Delphos International, Ltd. will be undertaking the feasibility study. This will be among Mozambique's first utility-scale wind power plants, thus helping to demonstrate the cost and performance of wind energy for the country, as well as help improve access to electricity in Mozambique.

title.narrative: Manhia Wind Power and Storage Plant, through DNV GL Energy USA, Inc, f/k/a DNV KEMA Renewables, Inc.

description.narrative: This grant partially funds a feasibility study to assess the technical, financial, and economic viability of a wind power plant of 130 megawatts (MW) to be developed in two phases of 65 MW each, along with energy storage of 10-20 MW (20-40 MW hours), as well as associated transmission and interconnection infrastructure in Manhia district in Maputo Province, Mozambique. The grantee is Globeleq Calanga Wind, SA and the U.S. firm DNV GL Energy USA, Inc. will be undertaking the feasibility study. This will be among Mozambiques first utility-scale wind power plants, thus helping to demonstrate the cost and performance of wind energy for the country, as well as to improve access to electricity in Mozambique. This $1,435,908 grant partially funds a feasibility study to assess the technical, financial, and economic viability of a wind power plant of 130 megawatts (MW) to be developed in two phases of 65 MW each, along with energy storage of 10-20 MW (20-40 MW hours), as well as associated transmission and interconnection infrastructure in Manhia district in Maputo Province, Mozambique. The grantee is Globeleq Calanga Wind, SA and the U.S. firm DNV GL Energy USA, Inc. will be undertaking the feasibility study. This will be among Mozambiques first utility-scale wind power plants, thus helping to demonstrate the cost and performance of wind energy for the country, as well as to improve access to electricity in Mozambique.

title.narrative: 78 MW Gas-Fired Power Plant in Chokwe District, through Delphos International, Ltd.

description.narrative: A USTDA grant is partially funding a feasibility study (Study) to assess technical, financial and economic aspects of a 78 megawatt mobile gas-fired thermal power plant, including associated transmission lines and a gas pipeline spur (Project), in the Chokwe District of Gaza Province in Mozambique. The Project is being developed by Kuikila Investments, Lda., an independent power developer in Mozambique. The Study is being undertaken by the U.S. firm Delphos International, Ltd. of Washington, D.C. The Study includes a final environmental and social impact assessment, final grid study, revisions and finalization of the tolling and other legal agreements, insurance program design, and financial modeling. The Project will directly address Mozambique's power infrastructure needs through increased generation and new transmission infrastructure.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles
